body_html:
As @llhe said, refcount.h was included before grpc_call.h in #8493

+#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/refcount.h"
+#include "tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_call.h"

And in #9384

-#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/refcount.h"
#include "tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_call.h"
+#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/refcount.h"

Not sure I understand why in #9384 the merge operation show conflicts of ~260 files, that were not relevant to the specific pull request.
Working with rebase would have the same effect here ?

body:
As @llhe said, refcount.h was included before grpc_call.h in #8493

+#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/refcount.h"
+#include "tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_call.h"

And in #9384

-#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/refcount.h"
  #include "tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_call.h"
 +#include "tensorflow/core/lib/core/refcount.h"

Not sure I understand why in #9384 the merge operation show conflicts of ~260 files, that were not relevant to the specific pull request.
Working with rebase would have the same effect here ?
